intro: Platysace saxatilis, commonly known as the rock platysace, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It is a member of the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and showy, pink to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or coastal areas, adapting to harsh environmental conditions. Its small, palmate leaves and clustered inflorescences make it a distinctive species within its habitat. It is often used in horticulture for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in well-drained soils.
